DeregistrationReasonOtherText: San Bernardino County agency determined program no longer required

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Overview

The Fontana Extrusion Operation is located at 11711 Pacific Avenue, Fontana, California, it is bordered on the north by Arrow Group Industries, on the south by Cliffstar Juice Company, on the east by a storm channel and on the west by Pacific Avenue. 

Distances from Fontana Extrusion Operation Building to the property lines:

North, 54 feet from building wall to fence line (Arrow Group Industries).

South, 58.10 feet from building wall to fence line (Cliffstar Juice Company).

East 135.7 feet from building wall to storm channel. 

West, 54 feet from building wall to curb line on Pacific Avenue. 

The Fontana Extrusion operates two 1800 ton extrusion presses, one horizontal paint line and a thermal improvement process. The paint line utilizes Alodine 47S which is used to pre-treat the aluminum prior to painting. 

Paint Pre-Treatment Overview 

In order to comply with the American Architectural Manufacturers Association (AAMA) 2605 and U.S. Military,Mil-C-5541 standards, Sierra Aluminum uses Alodine 47S, manufactured by Henkel Surface Technologies, which contains 19% to 20% Hydrogen Fluoride in the aluminum pre treatment stage. AAMA 2605 and Mil-C-5541 require a chromate pre-treatment process to meet their corrosion and durability requirements. Alodine 47S is a coating that is applied to the surface of the extruded aluminum prior to painting the aluminum. Worst case scenario in our example would be a breach of the largest vessel, a drum containing 470 lbs. of 20% HF Solution.

The equations used are in Appendix D of the Risk Management Program Guidance for Offsite Consequence Analysis. See Excel Spread Sheet for Values.

Drum contains: H2O = 373.61 lbs.
                       HF    = 96.39 lbs.

Spill would take place in the building with a volume of 2940000 FT³. at 25 deg C. 

The toxic end point of one tenth the IDLH of 30 = 3 ppm our analysis indicates a ppm of no greater than 2.25 at the building perimeter. This would qualify our process as a

Program 1 RMP.

Our procedures call for the delivery of the material to take place within the building and storage of the material to be in containment units. 

Graphic of containment unit is included as an attached file.
